intro: Anthemis ubensis, commonly known as the Ukrainian tansy, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Central and Eastern Europe. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring narrow, lance-shaped leaves with a distinctive grayish-blue hue. Its flowers are yellow, arranged in flat-topped clusters, and bloom from late spring to early autumn. Anthemis ubensis is often found in meadows, grasslands, and along roadsides, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
